title: Male body found at Pettah floating market
byline: An unidentified male body has been discovered in the lake near the Floating Market in Pettah, police said.

title: Kusal Perera’s century leads Sri Lanka to thrilling win over New Zealand
byline: Kusal Janith Perera’s scintillating century guided Sri Lanka to a thrilling 7-run victory over New Zealand in the third and final T20I in Nelson on Thursday.

title: Asoka Ranwala’s ‘Dr’ post takes a ridiculous turn
byline: The controversy surrounding former Speaker Asoka Ranwala’s doctorate has taken a bizarre twist, with NPP MP K. Ilankumaran from the Jaffna District describing Ranwala as a “Medical Doctor’’.

title: Passport queues to exist further in New Year
byline: The crisis involved in the issuance of passports is to exist further in the New Year, since the available stock is sufficient only for the first half of this year, and the government is still at a loss to call for tenders to get fresh copies of the P-series.

title: Mother of Altair victim to sue CIS for alleged negligence
byline: The untimely death of Jivon Zoro Singh (15), a student of Colombo International School (CIS) who fell to his death from the Altair luxury apartment complex sparked much controversy over the past few months.

title: Ruwan Wanigasooriya appointed Chief of National Intelligence
byline: Major General Ruwan Wanigasooriya (Retd) has been appointed as the new Chief of National Intelligence, the Ministry of Defence said.

title: Chief of National Intelligence Kulatunga retires
byline: Major General (Rtd) Ruwan Kulatunga, the Chief of National Intelligence (CNI), retired from his position on December 31, 2024.

title: Third school term begins today
byline: The second stage of the third term for the 2024 academic year in all government and government-approved private schools begins today

title: No one is foolish enough to kill Mahinda Rajapaksa: SF
byline: Responding to rumors of possible life threats to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka stated that no one is foolish enough to kill him using drones.

title: SLFP to contest upcoming elections under ‘Chair’ symbol: Duminda Dissanayake
byline: The Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) will contest the upcoming elections, including the Local Government and Provincial Council elections, under the ‘Chair’ symbol, SLFP general secretary Duminda Dissanayake said today.

title: Ranil meets Nepali Prime Minister
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has met Prime Minister of Nepal KP Sharma Oli on Thursday at the prime minister’s residence in Baluwatar.

title: Sanga, Mahela back ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ initiative
byline: Sri Lanka’s cricket legends Mahela Jayawardena and Kumar Sangakkara have thrown their weight behind the government’s newly launched ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ initiative.

title: No cut on allowance paid to kidney patients: Government
byline: Refuting reports of moves to stop the allowance paid to kidney patients, the government said today that the allowance paid to kidney patients will be increased to Rs. 10,000.

title: Australia to play two Test matches at Galle
byline: The Australian cricket team will arrive in Sri Lanka on January 20 for a series comprising two Test matches and one One-Day International (ODI).

title: Mass shooting in Queens leaves at least 11 people injured
byline: Police in Queens, New York are investigating a reported mass shooting at a nightclub on Wednesday that has left at least 11 people wounded.

title: Cybertruck filled with fuel and fireworks explodes at Trump’s Las Vegas hotel
byline: Police are investigating after a Tesla Cybertruck filled with fuel canisters and firework mortars exploded outside the Trump Hotel in Las Vegas, Nevada.

title: Air Force to get 8 Bell helicopters from the USA & trainer aircraft from Pakistan
byline: The Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) is to enhance its air capabilities with the addition of eight Bell 206 helicopters from the United States and an FT-7 trainer aircraft from Pakistan this year, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: One inmate in Matara prison dies after Bo tree falls down, 10 injured
byline: One inmate in Matara prison was reported dead and ten others were injured when a Bo tree within the prison premises fell on them.
